component.text: Lists the complete configuration currently active in RAM.
The active configuration can be copied to NVRAM.

component.feedback: ***You must enter the exact and full command. Commands that include a name or password are case-sensitive.***
component.existingcommands: Enter the command to save the running configuration stored in RAM to NVRAM.

command.instruction:
The configuration in RAM and the configuration in NVRAM are now the same. If you want to restore the switch to its default "out-of-the-box" configuration, you must enter two commands.
First, enter the command that will remove the vlan.dat file.
On a real switch, the IOS waits for you to confirm the file name and then confirm the delete. Now enter the command to remove the configuration stored in NVRAM.

command.deviceresponse:
Erasing the nvram filesystem will remove all configuration files! Continue? [confirm]
[OK]
Erase of nvram: complete
command.instruction: On a real switch, the IOS waits for you to confirm the erase command. The final step to return a switch to its default configuration is to reboot the switch.

command.deviceresponse:
Proceed with reload? [confirm]
C2960 Boot Loader (C2960-HBOOT-M) Version 12.2(25r)FX, RELEASE SOFTWARE (fc4)
Cisco WS-C2960-24TT (RC32300) processor (revision C0) with 21039K bytes of memory.
2960-24TT starting...
<output omitted>
command.instruction: Enter privileged EXEC mode and view the current configuration stored in NVRAM.

The switch is restored to its default "out-of-the-box" configuration.
You successfully saved and then erased the switch configuration.
